Job Title: Chief Engineer

Location: Huntsville, AL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Description BAE Systems is seeking a skilled Chief Systems Engineer to join our Analysis, Testing & Development Future Vertical Lift (FVL) team supporting the US Army's PEO Aviation/FVL Cross Functional Team in the Huntsville area under BAE Systems IDS Business unit of the Intelligence & Security (I&S) Sector. This effort supports analyses, testing, digital engineering, and development to improve Reliability, Maintainability, Quality, Supportability, and Interoperability (RMQSI) for weapons systems while evaluating new technologies for potential implementation and transitioning and employing Modular Open System Architecture (MOSA) within the Enduring and FVL Aviation portfolio.



Job Summary


The FVL Chief Engineer will provide technical leadership for day-to-day engineering operations. Responsible for providing planning, direction, and coordination of all engineering efforts. This position is responsible for technical performance and engineering costs and schedules and serves as the Contractor's technical spokesperson for projects and/or programs. Advises the Program Manager, Deputy Program Manager, and Government Stakeholders on schedule, budget, and technical priorities for the enduring and FVL weapon systems and associated avionics and missions.



Responsibilities


Research, analyze, and evaluate emerging FVL technologies and tools.Prepare briefings to decision-makers and stakeholders within the DoD and PEO Aviation and FVL enterprise showcasing operational effectiveness and efficiency benefits.Support annual conference with (100-150) USG participants.Produce recommendation reports, analysis of alternatives, and gap analysis of any relevant tools and technology that can aid PEO Aviation for Enduring and FVL missions.Identify current capabilities, deployments, and integrations done through methods such as red teaming and war-gaming simulations, manufacturer inquiries, and tactical and strategic data.Support the customer to identify, plan and manage their capability initiatives, consistent with Program.Identify technology insertion points to ensure technology is consistent with unique project (protection, reliability, MOSA, scalability, etc.) needs.Work with developers to ensure correct application and successful transition of technology.Prepare and present briefings to FVL Program Manager, Deputy Program Manager and others as required.Location is flexible but requires ability to support project team and customer in Huntsville, AL area.Support customer management in coordinating all visits to the contractor facilities.Support the submittal of applicable CDRLs to the Program based off the contractual requirements due dates and milestones.Support planning and briefings to the customer, major stakeholders, and management on the execution of task order activities on the avionic equipment, systems and sub-systems that may impact the warfighter or system with an emphasis on MOSA.Identify and report to program management potential obsolescence issues and provide sound mitigation recommendations and document all coordinated activities.Lead and drive actions and initiatives that improve customer satisfactionEmbrace and promote a continuous improvement culture, enabling contractor support to be more effective and efficient to improve the ease of doing business for our customers.Foster an environment that encourages teamwork, open communication, camaraderie, personal accountability, and mutual respect across Contractor support and business segmentsCreate an environment that adheres to and embraces the culture and commitment on Ethics & compliance policies.Ensure BAE Systems directives, policies, and procedures are implemented and enforced.


Required Education, Experience, & Skills 

Bachelor’s degree with a focus in digital engineering, model based systems engineering, or a related field of study.12+ years of related, proven experience in technical management overseeing complex, multi-team projects of similar scale as the proposed effort.Direct experience with digital engineering for the development and test and integration of aviation weapon systems.Proven experience leading teams to develop new and existing products, solutions, and processes.Demonstrated ability to think and plan strategically while executing tactically.Experience in a large, complex multifaceted system and system of systems engineering, testing & integration environment.Experience with project logistics by managing and balancing project resources across multiple competing priorities. Including securing adequate resources needed by the teams to meet schedule.Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively present complex information to senior leaders with diverse backgrounds.Communicates effectively and accurately convey status and identify, assess, and communicate risks.Strong written and oral communication skills, including the ability to express technical ideas to senior decision makers.Strong leadership and organizational skills.Experience with Digital Engineering and Model Based Systems Engineering.Experience analyzing user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate or improve existing systems.Experience ensuring developed systems comply with the enterprise technical architecture.Exceptional verbal and written communication.Experience working Government/Military programs.Working knowledge of Military Aircraft avionic development and requirements analysis.


Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills 

Master’s degree with a focus in Avionics Engineering, Digital Systems Engineering, Model Based Systems Engineering, or a related STEM field of study; or a master’s degree with a focus in Aerospace, engineering, or a related field of study.16+ years of related, proven experience in systems engineering or solutions architecture overseeing complex, multi-team efforts of similar scale as the Contractor’s proposed effort.Industry certifications.Direct experience with a background in Army Aviation for both Fixed-wing and vertical lift aircraft to include the development of avionic systems and requirements analysis.Working knowledge of military aircraft avionic systems testing or training.Experience managing remote and distributed teams.Strong communication skills. An active Top Secret US Security Clearance with SCI.Experience with US Army or related military experience.Leadership experience.


Pay Information

Full-Time Salary Range: $147300 - $250400

Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.

Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.


About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.



Our Commitment To Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion


At BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

Experience Level (if available): Director
